column3: ['S1: Place-Place the dripper on top of a coffee mug']
['S2: Prepare-Prepare the filter insert by folding the paper filter in half to create a semi-circle
column4: and in half again to create a quarter-circle']

column3: ['S3: Place-Place the paper filter in the dripper']
['S4: Grind-Grind the coffee beans until the coffee grounds are the consistency of coarse sand
['S6: spread-spread open filter in dripper to create a cone']
['S7: Transfer-Transfer the grounds to the filter cone']
['S9: Boil-Boil the water. (While the water is boiling

column4: check the temperature of the water. (The water should be between 195-205 degrees Fahrenheit or between 91-96 degrees Celsius. If the water is too hot

column3: ['S11: Pour-Pour a small amount of water into the filter to wet the grounds']
['S12: Wait-Wait about 30 seconds for the coffee to bloom. (You will see small bubbles or foam on the coffee grounds during this step.)']
['S13: pour-Slowly pour the rest of the water over the grounds in a circular motion. Do not overfill beyond the top of the paper filter']
['S14: drain-Let the coffee drain completely into the mug before removing the dripper']
['S15: Discard-Discard the paper filter and coffee grounds']
